greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=(-1)^((n-2)*(n-1)/2)*2^(n-1)*n^(n-3).
comment: Fibonacci polynomials are defined as F(0)=0, F(1)=1 and F(n)=x*F(n-1)+F(n-2) for n>1. Coefficients are given in triangle A168561 with offset 1.
link: Rigoberto Flórez, Robinson Higuita, and Alexander Ramírez, The resultant, the discriminant, and the derivative of generalized Fibonacci polynomials, arXiv:1808.01264 [math.NT], 2018.
Rigoberto Flórez, Robinson Higuita, and Antara Mukherjee, Star of David and other patterns in the Hosoya-like polynomials triangles, 2018.
R. Flórez, R. Higuita and A. Mukherjees, Characterization of the strong divisibility property for generalized Fibonacci polynomials, Integers, 18 (2018), Paper No. A14.
R. Flórez, N. McAnally, and A. Mukherjees, Identities for the generalized Fibonacci polynomial, Integers, 18B (2018), Paper No. A2.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Fibonacci Polynomial
program: (PARI) concat([1], [poldisc(p) | p<-Vec(x/(1-x^2-y*x) - x + O(x^20))]) \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 26 2018
results.author: _Rigoberto Florez_, Aug 26 2018
